duties_responsibilities.duty: Coordinate and utilize drivers, trucks, and containers to maximize productivity and ensure efficient service to customers.
Analyze and interpret various types of logistics data to make decisions that increase overall routing accuracy.
Communicate with drivers to check route progress and provide necessary information for efficient operations.
Design and sequence routes that are operationally efficient and make sense for logistics purposes.
Ensure the highest level of customer satisfaction by executing service commitments and addressing customer needs.
Constantly monitor and adjust daily and future plans to respond to unexpected events and optimize routing efficiencies.
Evaluate and prioritize promises made to customers to ensure timely and efficient service.
Manage online presence and social media channels to enhance brand visibility and promote freight and logistics services.
Plan and oversee participation in industry events, conferences, and trade shows to showcase services and network with potential clients.
Analyze market trends, customer behavior, and competitor activity to identify growth opportunities and refine strategies.
Lead a team of logistics analysts and specialists, fostering collaboration and guiding their efforts towards achieving set goals.
Report driver performance issues and make real-time changes to routes to increase efficiency and accuracy.
Resolve problems that may arise while trucks and drivers are in transit, ensuring timely resolution.
Collect, interpret, and analyze logistics data to make decisions that improve routing accuracy and maximize efficiency.
Review and update disposal plans, service areas, and customer commitments to optimize logistics operations.
Evaluate route issues that may cause delays and utilize available tools to communicate with impacted customers.
Measure and report on the performance of logistics operations, using data-driven insights to continuously improve strategies.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business, or a related field (Master's preferred)
